meta_description: The Museum invites you to explore our Collection of American art of the 20th and 21st centuries and to discover Western North Carolina’s unique artistic history.
hours_text:
Since 1948, the Asheville Art Museum has welcomed visitors from Western North Carolina, the Southeast, and around the country and world to explore American art of the 20th and 21st centuries.

## Visiting the Museum

#### Hours (Interim 2025)

  * Monday CLOSED
  * Tuesday CLOSED
  * Wednesday 11am–6pm
  * Thursday 11am–6pm
  * Friday 11am–6pm
  * Saturday 11am–6pm
  * Sunday 11am–6pm

The [Museum Store](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220211114/https://shop.ashevilleart.org/), [Perspective Café](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220211114/http://ashevilleart.org/cafe), and [Wells Fargo Art PLAYce](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220211114/https://www.ashevilleart.org/learn/wells-fargo-art-playce/), our intergenerational makerspace, are open during Museum hours. The [Frances Mulhall Achilles Art Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220211114/https://www.ashevilleart.org/learn/art-library/) is open to Members by appointment.

#### Reserve Your Tickets

Pre-purchased online tickets are encouraged for a contactless experience; walk-in tickets are also available. Tickets are released on the 15th of each month and are non-refundable.

[RESERVE TICKETS NOW](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220211114/https://www.ashevilleart.org/visit/ticket-options/) [BECOME A MEMBER](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220211114/https://www.ashevilleart.org/membership/)

#### Admission (Interim 2025)

  * Always free for [Museum Members](http://web.archive.org/web/20251220211114/https://www.asheville...

accessibility_text:
The Museum’s vision is to transform lives through art, and we welcome all visitors without discrimination. If you have questions, suggestions, or specific requests related to accessibility, please call 828.253.3227 or [click here to email us](/web/20260101095539/https://www.ashevilleart.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#0f637d607c7c60614f6e7c676a796663636a6e7d7b21607d68). We welcome feedback and continually strive to improve the Museum experience for all visitors.

#### For visitors with mobility impairments

The Museum does not have its own parking facility. There are several parking decks nearby, as well as metered and free street parking. Parking decks have designated spaces for vehicles with a disability permit and spaces for oversize vehicles. For real-time information about city parking decks, [click here](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101095539/http://avlpark.com/). There are two accessible parking spaces on Pack Square, and two just south of Pack Square on Biltmore Avenue. All spaces are available on a first-come, first-served basis. For more information about parking, [click here](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101095539/https://www.ashevilleart.org/visit).

We can accommodate drop-offs and pickups on the Museum’s plaza, located at the corner of Biltmore Avenue and Pack Square.

The main entrance is on the plaza level, through automatic doors. The entire Museum building is accessible by elevator; please ask staff for any assistance you may need.
